Technique: DOVETAIL (JOINT); WRITTEN WITH A REED PEN/REED WITH SPLIT NIB
Name: Greek papyrus
Description: This fragment of papyrus which comes from Narmouthis contains a series of succesive receipts given in return for the payments of taxes imposed per person. The last payment dates from a month before the death of the emperor Hadrian, that is to say of 15 June 138 of our time.
